page.title: 14THE OLD HOUSE-TIMBER FRAMED
page.content: {The Old House}is a timber framed house on the High Street, from Turners Hill to Handcross. The centre of the house was once 2 old cottages. The eastern cottage was built first, the western cottage was added 5 years later.In the 19th century a brick built wing was added to the eastern side, and in the 20th century a porch with a room over it was added to the western end. It has 2 main fireplaces. In the east cottage on the{ingle beam}are the letters{T.G. I.G. 1737,}in the west cottage{I.D. 1742.}giving dates of the building. The letters T.G,I.G are the initials of the man who owned it, Thomas Gibbs and his wife.In the hearth of the East house are 2 small cupboards and the door of a brick oven. At the front of the house are projections under the chimneys which are the ovens.
